children.text: Happy news for me this week, as the Ghost platform that I use to publish this site finally gains the ability to
keep rich Twitter formatting in its newsletters
. So, to celebrate, here are five tweets that caught my attention recently, that you might enjoy — or even *
gasp*
find useful.
1. The BBC won't cover this!

children.html:
Classic of the genre… pic.twitter.com/IHXspyf9fH

— Paul McNamara (@PGMcNamara) December 8, 2021

users.description: Business and Global Trade Correspondent for @Channel4News; all views usually belong to someone else far cleverer and passed off as my own...
users.name: Paul McNamara

children.text: For many of us the “why aren't the BBC/MSM/Newspapers covering this?” tweet is an annoying itch that you can never quite scratch away. This, however, is an absolute masterpiece of the clueless form.
2. Amazing what you can do with an iPhone and its (wired) headphones

children.html:
BBC reporter @EmmaVardyTV has had to do her PTC for her report in the midst of #StormBarra for the main BBC TV6 news bulletin on her phone after her crew’s broadcast camera stopped working in the atrocious weather. #mojoftw pic.twitter.com/aJIQ6TbxPq

— Marc Blank-Settle (@MarcSettle) December 7, 2021

domain.name: Brand Vertical
domain.description: Top level entities that describe a Brands industry

domain.name: Brand Category
domain.description: Categories within Brand Verticals that narrow down the scope of Brands

domain.name: Brand Category
domain.description: Categories within Brand Verticals that narrow down the scope of Brands

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical
domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

tweet_data.text: BBC reporter @EmmaVardyTV has had to do her PTC for her report in the midst of #StormBarra for the main BBC TV6 news bulletin on her phone after her crew’s broadcast camera stopped working in the atrocious weather. #mojoftw https://t.co/aJIQ6TbxPq

users.description: BBC trainer. Mobile Journalism, apps, Wedding Present, Arsenal. My views ≠ BBC's. RT = worth reading not approval. Like = read later. Sharing apps ≠ endorsement
users.name: Marc Blank-Settle

users.description: Ireland Correspondent BBC News 🇮🇪🇬🇧 Political Studies Assoc Journalist of the Year & RTS Award winner. Also some 🏄‍♀️ ⚽️ & 🏃‍♀️ 📷 Insta: emmavardytv
users.name: Emma Vardy

children.text: A storm wipes out the normal broadcast camera kit. So an iPhone, a cable clip inside the jacket and some wired headphones with a microphone on them does the job.
3. Anatomy of the story of the week

children.html:
Strongly advise @cityjournalism students to listen to @BBCRadio4's #TheMediaShow where @PippaCrerar & @PaulBrandITV talk to @BBCRosAtkins abt the Downing Street party story. In-depth look at how stories are broken, protection of sources & ethical dilemmas https://t.co/6uLlgZmaKw

— Dr Glenda Cooper (@glendacooper) December 8, 2021

urls.title: BBC Radio 4 - The Media Show, Inside the No 10 Christmas party scoops
urls.description: How The Mirror and ITV News uncovered the political story of the year.

users.name: Ros Atkins
users.description: Outside Source & explainers on BBC News, founder of the 50:50 Project, Texting Keith Olbermann podcast, the Media Show on Radio 4, squash enthusiast

children.text: As
Glenda
says, an essential listen on the dynamics that led to one of the stories that's dominating UK headlines this week.
4. Who owns the .media (the dot is not a typo…)

children.html:
I was curious, who actually owns the ".media" top level domain name? Well, turns out it's basically a bunch of opportunists ... and who has a partnership with Demand Media (Leaf Group) ... a company that doesn't really have a good reputation online. https://t.co/RsFRTD60bX pic.twitter.com/PMFkNcLCpr

— Thomas Baekdal (@baekdal) November 24, 2021

tweet_data.text:
I was curious, who actually owns the ".media" top level domain name? Well, turns out it's basically a bunch of opportunists ... and who has a partnership with Demand Media (Leaf Group) ... a company that doesn't really have a good reputation online. 
https://t.co/RsFRTD60bX https://t.co/PMFkNcLCpr

users.name: Thomas Baekdal
users.description: Author, Professional Writer, Magazine Publisher, and Media Analyst.

children.text: If you buy a .media domain, who are you giving money to?
Baekdal
decided to find out…
5. Why you should always check crops on your Twitter cards…

children.html:
What’s a story for, she screams existentially.

Thanks @InPublishing for humouring my (data-informed) musings 🤙https://t.co/ywUqENkI15

— Taneth Autumn Evans (@TanethAutumn) December 9, 2021

urls.title: What’s a story for?
urls.description: When publishing a story, are publishers asking the right questions? What is the story there to do? This, as The Sunday Times’s Taneth Evans tells Ciar Byrne, is …

tweet_data.text:
What’s a story for, she screams existentially.

Thanks @InPublishing for humouring my (data-informed) musings 🤙

https://t.co/ywUqENkI15

users.description: Associate editor @thesundaytimes. Was head of audience @thetimes. INMA 30 under 30 rising stars in news media. Devoted to the residents of Ambridge
users.name: Taneth Autumn Evans

users.description: InPublishing publishes InPublishing magazine, the InPubWeekly e-newsletter, and The InPublishing Guide to Paid Content Strategies.
users.name: InPublishing

children.text: The piece is worth reading. The Twitter card is… not exactly selling the story, now, is it?
Bonus: Great story, amazing photo

children.html:
As Angela Merkel leaves office, I get to share my favourite photograph again.

In November 1990, a 36-year-old Merkel campaigns on the Baltic coast in Germany's first election after reunification. She reportedly drank five schnapps with them.https://t.co/iiVe9vyVxY pic.twitter.com/jDLkCfp14o

— Richard Hall (@_RichardHall) December 3, 2021

tweet_data.text:
As Angela Merkel leaves office, I get to share my favourite photograph again. 

In November 1990, a 36-year-old Merkel campaigns on the Baltic coast in Germany's first election after reunification. She reportedly drank five schnapps with them.

https://t.co/iiVe9vyVxY https://t.co/jDLkCfp14o

urls.title: As Germany's Merkel Steps Down, Those Who Guided Her Into Politics Remember Her
urls.description: On Sunday, German voters will choose a successor to Angela Merkel, who is stepping down as chancellor after 16 years. Some of her earliest supporters recall the day in 1990 when they first met her.

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

domain.name: Politician
domain.description: Politicians in the world, like Joe Biden

users.name: Richard Hall
users.description: Writing about America for @Independent after a long stint in Beirut. Formerly with @AFP and @TheWorld. richard.hall@independent.co.uk
